official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to allow the medical care deduction for lodging away from home in certain cases.

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow an income tax deduction for lodging costs incurred while undergoing medical treatment away from home. Requires that the medical care be provided by a physician in a licensed hospital or in a nationally or regionally recognized medical care facility and that there be no significant element of personal pleasure, recreation, or vacation in the travel away from home.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to allow the medical care deduction for lodging away from home in certain cases.
